title: QUANTITATION OF 17 β-ESTRADIOL IN RABBIT PLASMA BY HIGH-PERFORMANCE LIQUID CHROMATOGRAPHY WITH FLUORESCENCE DETECTION
abstract: A new method was developed for the determination of 17 β-estradiol in rabbit plasma by reversed-phase high performance liquid chromatography (RP-HPLC) with fluorescence (FL) detection. The method employed one-step extraction of 17 β-estradiol from plasma matrix with a mixture of water and ethylacetate (1.9:5, v/v) using estriol as an internal standard. The mobile phase consisted of a mixture of metanol and water (70:30, v/v) flowing at a flow rate of 1.0 mL min−1. Calibration curve was linear between concentration range of 125–6000 ng mL−1. Average recovery of 17 β-estradiol and the internal standard from the biological matrix was more than 94.9 and 92.5%, respectively. The intra-day and inter-day precision and accuracy were between 3.74–8.12 and 3.72–8.80%, respectively. Also, the method was successfully applied to determine of 17 β-estradiol in New Zealand white rabbits.

motivations: There is a need for a reliable and accurate method to quantify 17 β-estradiol in rabbit plasma.
objectives: Develop a new method for the determination of 17 β-estradiol in rabbit plasma using high-performance liquid chromatography with fluorescence detection.
methods: Employ reversed-phase high-performance liquid chromatography with fluorescence detection for the quantitation of 17 β-estradiol.
Use a one-step extraction process with a mixture of water and ethylacetate and estriol as an internal standard.
results: Achieve a linear calibration curve between 125–6000 ng mL−1 with high recovery rates of 17 β-estradiol and the internal standard.
Demonstrate good intra-day and inter-day precision and accuracy of the method.

openai_json.research_subject: Quantitation of 17 β-estradiol in rabbit plasma using high-performance liquid chromatography with fluorescence detection

motivations: There is a need for accurate and efficient methods to quantify 17 β-estradiol in biological samples for pharmacological and physiological studies.
objectives: Develop a new reversed-phase high-performance liquid chromatography method with fluorescence detection for determining 17 β-estradiol in rabbit plasma.
methods: Employ one-step extraction of 17 β-estradiol from plasma using water and ethylacetate mixture with estriol as internal standard.
Use reversed-phase HPLC with fluorescence detection and a mobile phase of methanol and water.
results: Achieved linear calibration curve between 125-6000 ng mL−1 with average recovery rates exceeding 94.9% for 17 β-estradiol.
Demonstrated high precision and accuracy with intra-day and inter-day variations below 8.80%.
Successfully applied the method to determine 17 β-estradiol levels in New Zealand white rabbits.
